latest news.eng_title: Edo 2024 governorship: Ighodalo and other matters, by Emeka Alex Duru
latest news.summary: The Edo State governorship election on September 21 is a crucial moment for the state. The National Chairman of the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC), Prof Mahmood Yakubu, has assured that the commission will ensure a free, fair, and credible election. However, the 2023 general elections under Yakubu's supervision were marred by controversy, leaving many Nigerians skeptical about the commission's neutrality. The security agencies in the state, particularly the Police, have also been accused of harassment and intimidation of opposition members. President Bola Tinubu's statement assuring the APC members that he will 'give Edo back to them' has raised concerns about the outcome of the election. The PDP candidate, Asue Ighodalo, stands out with a comprehensive manifesto that pledges to transform the state into a beacon of progress and prosperity. Ighodalo's person and antecedents offer hopes and assurances on what to expect if elected to office. His vision for Edo includes good governance, poverty reduction, education, and skill acquisition, as well as repositioning the healthcare system and transforming the state into the food basket of South-South Nigeria. The election is not about political parties, but about individuals and their capacities to deliver on their promises.
latest news.title: Edo 2024 governorship: Ighodalo and other matters, by Emeka Alex Duru

latest news.eng_title: Jigawa: We will ensure peaceful, credible LG election
latest news.summary: Governor Umar Namadi of Jigawa State has promised a peaceful and credible conduct of the upcoming local government election. He stated that his government is committed to ensuring the peaceful conduct of the election to strengthen democratic development in the state. According to Governor Namadi, 'Our party has, in the last 9 years, delivered the dividends of democracy to every community in the state.' He called on the people of Jigawa State to vote for APC candidates, citing their loyalty, patriotism, transparency, and commitment to serving the state and humanity. The local government election is one of the critical components of democracy in Nigeria, and Governor Namadi emphasized the importance of a peaceful and credible process. 'Voting for APC candidates in all 27 local government areas will help us in our collective effort toward making Jigawa State great,' he said.
latest news.title: Jigawa: We will ensure peaceful, credible LG election

latest news.eng_title: Edo 2024: Protect your votes, Otti tells Labour Party supporters
latest news.summary: Abia Governor Dr Alex Otti has called on Labour Party (LP) supporters in Edo to protect their votes during the state's Sept. 21 governorship election. Otti, who joined LP candidate Olumide Akpata during campaign rallies in Benin, said, 'I already know that you will vote for LP. My coming here is to tell you to protect your votes.' He emphasized the importance of young people staying behind at polling units to ensure the protection of the votes and following the results from the units to the wards, local government, and state collation centers. Otti expressed confidence in Akpata and his running mate, Yusuf Kadiri, stating that they were the best team to lead Edo. Senator Darlington Nwokocha also emphasized the party's commitment to peace and good governance, saying, 'Labour Party will apply the same successful strategies it is using in Abia if elected in Edo. LP won in Abia, and today, the state is enjoying good governance. Vote and protect your votes. Edo deserves change.'
latest news.title: Edo 2024: Protect your votes, Otti tells Labour Party supporters

latest news.eng_title: "The state will burn": Edo gubernatorial election heats up as NLC chair issues strong remarks
latest news.summary: The Nigeria Labour Congress (NLC) chairman in Edo State, Odion Olaye, has made incendiary comments ahead of the gubernatorial election on September 21, warning that the state 'will burn' if the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) candidate, Asue Ighodalo, is not declared the winner. Olaye stated, 'I want to assure you that PDP, our party, is going to win Egor 80 percent come the 21st of this month, and on the 22nd, they must declare Asue Ighodalo the winner.' The remarks have added to the already tense political atmosphere in Edo State, with both the PDP and the All Progressives Congress (APC) trading accusations and inflammatory rhetoric. The APC has dismissed allegations of electoral manipulation, labeling them as baseless. The Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) is under pressure to ensure a free and fair election, amid calls for restraint from political actors.
latest news.title: "The state will burn": Edo gubernatorial election heats up as NLC chair issues strong remarks

latest news.eng_title: Edo 2024: Parties, Candidates Raise Security Concern
latest news.summary: Ahead of the Edo State governorship election on September 21, some political parties and candidates expressed concern about security despite assurances from the Independent National Election Commission (INEC) and the Police. At a stakeholders meeting in Benin, INEC chairman Professor Mahmood Yakubu said the electoral body has tested machines for the polls and registered over 2.6 million voters. However, PDP chairman Tony Aziegbemi accused the Police of bias against the party, and governorship candidates from ADC, PRP, and NNPP expressed strong concern about security. APC acting chairman Emperor Jarret Tenebe expressed satisfaction with INEC's preparation and urged the Police to ensure the Edo Security Network (ESN) remains suspended. Mahmood reassured stakeholders that INEC is ready for the election, deploying BVAS machines for voter accreditation and result upload. IGP Kayode Egbetokun assured that the police would provide 'robust security' for the election and warned trouble makers of dire consequences.
latest news.title: Edo 2024: Parties, Candidates Raise Security Concern

latest news.eng_title: Why were backing Ighodalo in Edo governorship raceNANS
latest news.summary: The National Association of Nigerian Students (NANS) Zone B has endorsed Asue Ighodalo, the governorship candidate of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), for the September 21st Edo Governorship election. According to Comrade Isaac Ogieva, Deputy Coordinator of NANS Zone B, 'the leaders and students in the Zone are backing Ighodalo.'
latest news.title: Why were backing Ighodalo in Edo governorship raceNANS

latest news.eng_title: Why we're backing Ighodalo in Edo governorship race — NANS
latest news.summary: The National Association of Nigerian Students (NANS) Zone B has endorsed Asue Ighodalo, the governorship candidate of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), for the September 21st Edo Governorship election. According to Deputy Coordinator NANS Zone B, Comrade Isaac Ogieva, the decision was made after due consultation with stakeholders and reviewing the candidates' manifestos. Ogieva stated, 'anyone or group who sits on the fence is either a coward, traitor, or both.' He added that NANS is satisfied with Ighodalo's proposals for education, economy, agriculture, health, infrastructure, youth development, and sports, and urged Nigerian students in Edo State to vote for the Asue Ighodalo/Osarodion Ogie ticket. Ogieva assured that NANS will serve as a bridge between students and leaders to bring democracy's dividends to the students.
latest news.title: Why we're backing Ighodalo in Edo governorship race — NANS

latest news.eng_title: We're ready for Edo election - INEC assures
latest news.summary: The Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) has assured stakeholders in Edo State of its readiness for the September 21 governorship election. According to INEC Chairman, Prof Mahmoud Yakubu, active preparations for the election started last year with the release of the timetable and schedule of activities. Yakubu stated that 11 out of 13 statutory activities have been concluded, including the delivery of 184,438 Permanent Voters Cards (PVCs) to the state. He noted that the commission has announced that Edo State now has a total of 2,629,025 registered voters. Yakubu appealed to stakeholders to cooperate with the commission to ensure a credible election, saying, 'In particular, the IG will address us on security preparations for the elections, while I will address you on the electoral preparation and together, we will respond to issues and concerns you may wish to raise.'
latest news.title: We're ready for Edo election - INEC assures

latest news.eng_title: This State Will Burn If Ighodalo Is Not Declared Winner – Edo NLC Chair (Video)
latest news.summary: The chairman of the Nigeria Labour Congress in Edo state, Odion Olaye, has threatened that there will be chaos in the state if the Peoples Democratic Party's candidate, Asue Ighodalo, does not win the gubernatorial poll. In a viral video, Olaye assured supporters of victory and claimed that Ighodalo will win Egor with 80% of the vote on the 21st of this month. He warned that if the Independent National Electoral Commission fails to declare Ighodalo the winner on the 22nd, 'Edo state will burn.'
latest news.title: This State Will Burn If Ighodalo Is Not Declared Winner – Edo NLC Chair (Video)

news knowledge.eng_title: Guber Poll: This State Will Burn If Ighodalo Is Not Declared Winner - NLC Chairman
news knowledge.summary: Odion Olaye, chairman of the Nigeria Labour Congress (NLC) in Edo state, has made inflammatory remarks ahead of the September 21 gubernatorial election. In a viral video, Olaye assured supporters of victory for Asue Ighodalo, Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) candidate, and predicted that Edo state 'will burn' if INEC fails to declare Ighodalo the winner. He stated, 'If they refuse to do that, Edo state will burn.' The comments come amidst allegations and counter-allegations by parties, including claims of APC plans to use fake INEC staff to tamper with the Bimodal Voter Accreditation System (BVAS).
news knowledge.title: Guber Poll: This State Will Burn If Ighodalo Is Not Declared Winner - NLC Chairman

news knowledge.eng_title: Edo election: The Battle for Osadebey Avenue - A symbol of unyielding political power
news knowledge.summary: The upcoming Edo election on September 21, 2024, is a pivotal moment for the state, determining its future direction and leadership. Three leading candidates, Monday Okpebholo of the APC, Asuerinmen Ighodalo of the PDP, and Olumide Anthony Akpata of the LP, are vying for the position. The APC candidate has been criticized for avoiding engagement with the media and relying on proxies to convey his message. The PDP candidate has been actively engaging with the people, but faces challenges due to the diminishing popularity of the incumbent Governor. The LP candidate, a former NBA President, is seen as a credible alternative, but faces obstacles due to his ethnic background and senatorial district. The election's outcome will reflect the people's will, and it is crucial for electoral officials, security agents, and law enforcement personnel to safeguard the rights and safety of the Edo people. The election will be a test of democratic ideals, and the people of Edo will decide if the APC and PDP candidates' strategies are worthy of respect.
news knowledge.title: Edo election: The Battle for Osadebey Avenue - A symbol of unyielding political power

news knowledge.eng_title: Edo guber: Ighodalo confident of PDP's victory over APC candidate, Okpebholo
news knowledge.summary: Asue Ighodalo, the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) candidate for the Edo gubernatorial election, expressed confidence that the electorate will reject the opposition All Progressives Congress (APC) candidate, describing him as 'mediocre and incompetent.' Ighodalo made this statement at the PDP's official campaign flag-off in Ubiaja, Esan South-East Local Government Area, but did not mention the name of the APC candidate, Okpebholo. According to Ighodalo, the people of Edo State will make the right choice on September 21, 2024, when they vote for the PDP candidate.
news knowledge.title: Edo guber: Ighodalo confident of PDP's victory over APC candidate, Okpebholo

news knowledge.eng_title: Edo guber: Ighodalo needs no clandestine means to win, PDPrepliesAPC
news knowledge.summary: Olu Martins, Deputy Director General of the PDP's Asue/Ogie Campaign Management Council, stated that Asue Ighodalo, the PDP's gubernatorial candidate, does not need clandestine means to win the September 21, 2024 election in Edo State. Martins believes that Ighodalo's campaign is strong enough to secure a victory without resorting to underhanded tactics.
news knowledge.title: Edo guber: Ighodalo needs no clandestine means to win, PDPrepliesAPC

news knowledge.eng_title: Edo: PDP hails Appeal Court judgement affirming Ighodalo's candidacy
news knowledge.summary: The Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) has praised the Court of Appeal for its decision to uphold the nomination of Asue Ighodalo as the PDP candidate for the September 21, 2024 Edo State governorship election.
news knowledge.title: Edo: PDP hails Appeal Court judgement affirming Ighodalo's candidacy

news knowledge.eng_title: Asue Ighodalo Will Win Edo Guber Poll
news knowledge.summary: Edo State Governor Godwin Obaseki has declared that the Peoples Democratic Party's (PDP) candidate, Asue Ighodalo, will win the September governorship election and succeed him. Obaseki praised Ighodalo's intellect, integrity, and discipline, stating that he will do better than him as governor. Obaseki expressed confidence in Ighodalo's chances, saying 'I am convinced that with the efforts that all of you have put in, Asue Ighodalo will be the governor of Edo State come September 21, 2024.' He also commended the primary election that produced Ighodalo, calling it the best ever in the nation.
news knowledge.title: Asue Ighodalo Will Win Edo Guber Poll

news knowledge.eng_title: Edo Gubernatorial Election: Obaseki Predicts Victory for Asue Ighodalo
news knowledge.summary: Edo State Governor Godwin Obaseki has predicted a victory for Asue Ighodalo, the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) candidate in the upcoming September election, stating that he will take over his position. Obaseki believes Ighodalo will be a better governor due to his intelligence, honesty, and discipline. He praised the primary election that chose Ighodalo, saying it was the best ever, and expressed confidence in the party's chances of winning the election on September 21, 2024.
news knowledge.title: Edo Gubernatorial Election: Obaseki Predicts Victory for Asue Ighodalo

news knowledge.eng_title: PDP will win Edo gov election, Obaseki boasts
news knowledge.summary: Edo State Governor Godwin Obaseki met with PDP leaders from each ward to strategize ahead of the September 21, 2024 governorship election. Obaseki expressed the party's readiness for the election and thanked leaders for their commitment, dedication, and courage. He expressed confidence that the party's candidate, Asue Ighodalo, will win the election, citing his attributes, intelligence, and integrity. Obaseki also announced the inauguration of the State Campaign Council, Local Governments Campaign Council, and ward campaign teams, as well as the uploading of party agents' names into the INEC portal.
news knowledge.title: PDP will win Edo gov election, Obaseki boasts

news knowledge.eng_title: Edo guber election: Asue Ighodalo will win
news knowledge.summary: Edo State Governor Godwin Obaseki has declared that the Peoples Democratic Party's (PDP) candidate, Asue Ighodalo, will win the September governorship election and succeed him. Obaseki praised Ighodalo's intellect, integrity, and discipline, stating that he will do better than him as governor. Obaseki expressed confidence in Ighodalo's chances, saying 'I am convinced that with the efforts that all of you have put in, Asue Ighodalo will be the governor of Edo State come September 21, 2024.'
news knowledge.title: Edo guber election: Asue Ighodalo will win

news knowledge.eng_title: Shaibu: PDP hails court verdict affirming Ighodalo governorship candidate
news knowledge.summary: The Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) has welcomed the Federal High Court's decision to affirm Asue Ighodalo as its governorship candidate for the September 21, 2024 election in Edo State. The party described the judgement as a victory for democracy, rule of law, and a validation of the propriety and credibility of the primary election. The PDP's spokesman, Debo Ologunagba, said the judgement reaffirms Ighodalo as the preferred candidate of the majority of Edo State's people. The party congratulated Ighodalo and urged members to remain united and work together to ensure the party's victory in the election.
news knowledge.title: Shaibu: PDP hails court verdict affirming Ighodalo governorship candidate
